section.title: Introduction
section.para: In this lab, you will have the opportunity to get familiar with the Pivotal HD distribution. In addition, some of the steps you will perform here will make it possible to complete the later labs.

itemizedlist.title: Subjects you will gain experience with:

listitem.para: Familiarity with the overall Pivotal HD distribution

section.title: Exploring Pivotal HD
section.para: Take a few minutes to explore the VM. Using either the "Computer" icon or a command prompt, locate the Pivotal HD install folder (/usr/lib/gphd).
Take a look at the sub-folders listed and see if you can answer these questions:

listitem.para: On Which version of Hadoop is this Pivotal HD based? _____________
What version of Pig is installed? _____________
What version of Hive is installed? _____________

section.title: Exploring The Web Interfaces
section.para: There are web interfaces to many of the hadoop services which provide a large amount of information. Open the FireFox browser in your VM.

listitem.para: To access the NameNode web interface enter pivhdsne:50070 in the address bar.
Navigate around the NameNode web interface. Traverse the various links and determine what information that each reveals.
You can drill down on the "Live Nodes" link all the way to the HDFS Filesystem!!!
To access the Secondary NameNode web interface enter pivhdsne:50090 in the address bar.
The SecondaryNamenode primarily provides information regarding checkpoint related activities and directories. Select the Logs link to view the Secondary
To access the Application Manager web interface enter pivhdsne:8088 in the address bar.
The Application Manager web interface provides a wealth of information regarding jobs that have been submitted against the cluster. All of the links under
Cluster and Tools reveal information regarding those jobs submitted to the cluster, status, node health, scheduler information and much more. Traverse
the links to discover what information these links reveal.
To access the Job History Server web interface enter pivhdsne:19888 in the address bar.
The Job History web interface provides information regarding all Retired Jobs. That is all jobs submitted to the cluster that are no longer running. Traverse
the links in Application and Tools to determine what information is revealed.
